docs.lead_paragraph: Research suggests that mass incarceration of black men may be fueling an urgent public health crisis.
docs.snippet: Research suggests that mass incarceration of black men may be fueling an urgent public health crisis....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Laurie Shrage highlights research that seems to indicate that mass incarceration of African American men has led to spike in HIV infections and deaths from AIDS in black women; calls for number of measures to reduce HIV infection rates in prisons in addition to efforts to end practices that have led to mass incarceration of nonwhite men.

headline.main: Why Are So Many Black Women Dying of AIDS?
headline.print_headline: An AIDS Crisis for Black Women

docs.lead_paragraph: In interviews, even Americans who deplore Donald J. Trump’s call to ban Muslim immigrants are more fearful after the rampage in California.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Yamiche Alcindor, Christina Capecchi, Ashley Parker, Jeremy W. Peters, Rebecca Fairley Raney and John Surico.

docs.snippet: In interviews, even Americans who deplore Donald J. Trump’s call to ban Muslim immigrants are more fearful after the rampage in California....
docs.abstract: Interviews with American voters, even those who do not support Republican presidential candidate Donald J Trump and deplore his call to ban Muslim immigrants, make clear that they are more fearful now--after massacre in California--than at any time since Sept 11 terrorist attacks; Trump's support continues to rise, despite majority of voters who disapprove of his plan.

headline.print_headline: New Chapter in the History of U.S. Dread
headline.main: Attack Spurs New Chapter in History of Dread in the U.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese banks and firms have built or are in contracts to build at least 92 coal-fired power plants in 27 countries, undermining efforts on climate change.

byline.contributor: Chau Doan contributed reporting from Tam Hung Commune. Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

docs.snippet: Chinese banks and firms have built or are in contracts to build at least 92 coal-fired power plants in 27 countries, undermining efforts on climate change....
docs.abstract: Pledges made by China to cut growth of its greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 are undercut by large number of coal-fired power plants that are being built by Chinese companies, backed by state loans, across developing world; review of public records show at least 92 coal-fired plants will have been built or formally planned by Chinese companies since 2010.

headline.print_headline: China’s Emissions Pledges Are Undercut by a Boom in Coal Projects Abroad
headline.main: China’s Emissions Pledges Are Undercut by Boom in Coal Projects Abroad

docs.lead_paragraph: In a sea of truthiness, fact-checking is a lifesaver.
docs.snippet: In a sea of truthiness, fact-checking is a lifesaver....
docs.abstract: Campaign Stops column by Politifact editor Angie Drobnic Holan reflects on fact-checking of statements made by presidential candidates in 2016 campaign cycle; suggests those who profess feeling dispirited by lack of factual accuracy on campaign trail should be encouraged by fact that exposure of falsehoods is clearly increasing as campaign season progresses toward November.

headline.main: All Politicians Lie. Some Lie More Than Others.
headline.print_headline: All Politicians Lie. Some Lie More Than Others.
